speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me more about these skin lesions? How long have you been experiencing them, and are they itchy, painful, or tender to the touch?

speaker: Patient
text: They started a few weeks ago, and they're really hard to scratch, but they don't hurt when I touch them, doc.

speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me exactly where on your body are these skin lesions located - are they on your face, arms, legs, or somewhere else?

speaker: Patient
text: They're mostly on my tummy and arms, doc. I also found some on my legs, but not too many there.

speaker: Doctor
text: I'd like to examine the lesions more closely. Can you please remove your shirt or jacket so I can take a look?

speaker: Patient
text: I can do that. I'll just take off my shirt for you. *removes shirt* Okay, you can see them now.

speaker: Doctor
text:
Can you tell me more about the lesions - are they all roughly the same size, shape, and color, or do they vary in appearance?



Also, have you noticed any other symptoms, such as fever, swollen lymph nodes, or joint pain, in addition to the skin lesions?

speaker: Measurement
text:
RESULTS:

speaker: Doctor
text:

speaker: Patient
text: I don't really notice them being more concentrated on one side, doc. They're pretty evenly spread out on my arms, but there's a bit more on my left side, I guess.

speaker: Doctor
text:
Can you show me exactly where on your arms the lesions are located, and are they grouped together or scattered individually?

speaker: Patient
text:
Doc, they're on the top part of my arms, about here *points to the area on the arm*. Some are grouped together, and some are a bit scattered, I guess.

They feel really firm, doc, but not hard or soft like anything else. They're just... firm.

The color is the same all over, doc - it's like the skin itself. I mean, it's a bit lighter around the edges, but that's it.

text:

As for the itching, I don't really notice it getting worse or better at any specific time, doc. It's just kind of there, you know?

The lesions are pretty evenly spread out on both sides of my arms, I think.

I don't really know of any family history of anything like this, doc. My mom just says that my brother had chickenpox a month ago, but that doesn't seem to be related to this, does it?
